Steam bought versions of the games that use SecureROM dont use it, steam uses VAC instead.

"Steam bought versions of the games that use SecureROM dont use it, steam uses VAC instead."

This is not accurate - even on the steam store it warns that it comes with SecuRom version five, and Borderlands doesn't run through steam's systems but rather Gamespy's - VAC doesn't come into the equation at any point.

Tried playing online and I timeout before connecting to any servers, so that's too bad. Anyone had any better luck with this one?

SubGum - timing out whenever you try to connect to a server is pretty much par for the course for this game. Even legal retail versions have that issue.

What you need to do is find the ports the game uses either on the steam forums or gearbox forums and forward those in your router.  After you do that you may still have problems so here's a ridiculous fix that shouldn't work, but somehow does: Just start a singleplayer game, actually get into a map then back all the way out to the main menu and suddenly you should be able to join most games (so long as the host has his ports forwarded as well).

The going into a game and then backing out also fixes some issues where only a few servers will show up on the in game server browser if you happen to experience that as well.

It's a pretty buggy piece of shit when it comes to networking and Gearbox's priorities are all screwed up - releasing addon pacs with DRM before they even patch away these crippling network issues for the retail product.

Hey guys, just a quick noob question, here. I'm a little new to this.  His instructions are unrar into the installation directory. I don't have anything marked specifically "installation" for this game that I can find. 

Would the "installation directory"  be the My Documents>My Games>Borderlands path? 

Thanks for the help in advance.

@g1722
"Would the "installation directory" be the My Documents>My Games>Borderlands path?"

No, the game keeps some configuration files there (as many games do) but it's not the install directory (and yes that is needlessly complicated, no idea why game devs do it).  More than likely, so long as you didn't change it before installing, your install Directory is something long the lines of C:\Program Files\Gearbox\Boarderlands  If you got it through steam though it'll be in steam's directory under something like C:\program files\steam\steam apps\common\boarderlands

Have fun exploring your file system! These are some pretty basic computing skills here, they'll come in handy for you again and again.
